definition: ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: We all have our emotional hot and cold spots.
sentences.chinese: 我们都有情绪上的热点与冰点。

sentences.english: Permafrost is soil, often water-rich, that is below freezing.
sentences.chinese: 永久冻土通常具有冰点以下的丰富水资源。

sentences.english: The first chapter from a macro perspective of the "freezing" the birth of social background.
sentences.chinese: 第二章从历时性的角度对《冰点》作品进行文本分析。

sentences.english: North-South relations seem in a tailspin.
Tonight the temperature will fall to 3 degrees below freezing.
sentences.chinese: 今天很冷，温度降到了冰点。

sentences.english: It lowers the melting and freezing point of water.
sentences.chinese: 是因为食盐将水的熔点和冰点降低了。

sentences.english: The freezing point of pure water at standard atmospheric pressure is 32 F (0 C).
sentences.chinese: 在标准大气压力下，纯水的冰点是0℃。

sentences.english: The freezing point of water is 32 degrees Fahrenheit or zero degree centigrade.
sentences.chinese: 水的冰点是华氏32度，也就摄氏零度。

sentences.english: The world at the time was divided into two implacably opposed blocks and the Cold War was at its iciest.
sentences.chinese: 那时世界分成势不两立的两大阵营，冷战正处在冰点。

sentences.english: The thermometer registered only two degrees above freezing-point.
sentences.chinese: 温度计显示仅高于冰点两度。

sentences.english: Szostak's experiments show that cell walls are hardiest at near freezing temperatures.
sentences.chinese: 绍斯塔克的实验表明细胞壁在冰点附近最牢固。

sentences.english: It's very cold today; the temperature has dropped to freezing point.
sentences.chinese: 今天很冷，温度降到了冰点。

sentences.english: Surface hoar consists of frost crystals atop snowbanks .
sentences.chinese: 地面霜是由雪堤顶上的冰点以下水晶组成。

sentences.english: And frostbite is more common at pretty low temperatures, well below freezing.
sentences.chinese: 而处于远低于冰点的相当低温度中，冻疮更常见。

sentences.english: The feasibility to reduce the ice point of firewater for freezing protection is discussed.
sentences.chinese: 探讨采用降低消防用水冰点达到防冻效果的可能性。

definition: to become hot/temperature rise/(fig.) to intensify/to hot up/to escalate/to get a boost
to become cooler/to lower the temperature/cooling/(of interest, activity etc) to decline
to rise again after a fall/to pick up/rally (stock market etc)
